intro: Hieracium hypochoeroides subsp. pseudowiesbaurianiforme, commonly known as the Wiesbaur's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has smooth, hairy, or glandular leaves that are often lobed or toothed. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly elongated flower heads and specific leaf morphology compared to other members of the species.
